dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: A 14-day return window is pretty standard, I'm not sure extending it just for unverified phones is going to solve much.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: A fourteen-day return window is pretty standard, I'm not sure extending it just for unverified phones is going to solve much.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: But that's the thing, Damir Seissembekov from the Telecommunications Committee says it's a major consumer protection issue. Unverified smartphones can be a real problem.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But that's the thing, Damir Seissembekov from the Telecommunications Committee says it's a major consumer protection issue. Unverified smartphones can be a real problem.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Starting June 25, Kazakh consumers will be able to return unverified smartphones for a refund, even if more than two weeks have passed since the purchase, the head of the Telecommunications Committee of the Ministry of Digital Development, Innovations and Aerospace Industry, Damir Seissembekov, said. According to Seissembekov, amendments to the law on Protection of Consumer Rights are currently under consideration in the Mazhilis.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, but like, how many people are actually buying these unverified devices? It seems like a niche problem.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, but like, how many people are actually buying these unverified devices? It seems like a niche problem.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Well, the new rule starting June 25th means if your phone isn't in the national database, you can get a refund no matter how long it's been. That's huge for buyers who get stuck with a dud.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, the new rule starting June twenty fifth means if your phone isn't in the national database, you can get a refund no matter how long it's been. That's huge for buyers who get stuck with a dud.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Starting June 25, Kazakh consumers will be able to return unverified smartphones for a refund, even if more than two weeks have passed since the purchase, the head of the Telecommunications Committee of the Ministry of Digital Development, Innovations and Aerospace Industry, Damir Seissembekov, said. "If a smartphone has not passed verification, the buyer will be able to return it to the seller, regardless of the circumstances.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: But if retailers are already aware, won't they just stop selling those phones? Seems like it fixes itself.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But if retailers are already aware, won't they just stop selling those phones? Seems like it fixes itself.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Ideally, yeah, but uh, mistakes happen. And Seissembekov mentioned you can still verify the phone after purchase if needed.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Ideally, yeah, but uh, mistakes happen. And Seissembekov mentioned you can still verify the phone after purchase if needed.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: However, if a customer does end up purchasing an unverified smartphone, it will still be possible to complete the verification process after the purchase. "If this happens, we're allowing both sellers and buyers to carry out the verification procedure in accordance with the established process," Seissembekov said.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: So wait, even if you buy one accidentally, you're not totally out of luck? You can still get it later?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So wait, even if you buy one accidentally, you're not totally out of luck? You can still get it later?

dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. The process is really about giving consumers a safety net, which I think is a smart move.
